qas.question: Which soda company has Beyonce partnered with since 2002?
Pepsi paid Beyonce how much in 2012 for her endorsement?
Which organization wrote a letter to Beyonce after her Pepsi endorsement deal?

answers.text: The Center for Science in the Public Interest (CSPINET)

qas.question: What percentage of people were positive about Beyonce's endorsement of Pepsi?
When did Beyonce begin doing Pepsi advetisments?
Who was in the commercial with Beyonce in 2004?

answers.text: Britney Spears, Pink, and Enrique Iglesias

qas.question: What did she agree to do for 50 million dollars in 2012?
Who sent her a letter asking that she reconsider the Pepsi deal?

answers.text: Center for Science in the Public Interest

qas.question: What soft drink company has Beyoncé worked with since 2002?
How much did Beyoncé get for a deal with a soft drink company in 2012?
Who asked her to change her mind about the soft drink deal due to the nature of the product?

answers.text: The Center for Science in the Public Interest (CSPINET)

qas.question: What organization discovered that the advertisements Beyoncé did for the soft drink company were 70% positive?

context: Beyoncé has worked with <a0_0><a8_0>Pepsi<a8_0/><a0_0/> since <a4_0>2002<a4_0/>, and in 2004 appeared in a Gladiator-themed commercial with <a5_0>Britney Spears, Pink, and Enrique Iglesias<a5_0/>. In 2012, Beyoncé signed a <a9_0>$<a1_0>50 million<a9_0/><a1_0/> deal to <a6_0>endorse Pepsi<a6_0/>. <a2_0><a10_0>The <a7_0>Center for Science in the Public Interest<a7_0/> (CSPINET)<a10_0/><a2_0/> wrote Beyoncé an open letter asking her to reconsider the deal because of the unhealthiness of the product and to donate the proceeds to a medical organisation. Nevertheless, <a11_0>NetBase<a11_0/> found that Beyoncé's campaign was the most talked about endorsement in April 2013, with a <a3_0>70<a3_0/> per cent positive audience response to the commercial and print ads.
